glsa.title: Paramiko: Information disclosure
glsa.synopsis: Unsafe randomness usage in Paramiko may allow access to sensitive information.

background.p: Paramiko is a Secure Shell Server implementation written in Python.

description.p: Dwayne C. Litzenberger reported that the file "common.py" does not properly use RandomPool when using threads or forked processes.

impact.p: A remote attacker could predict the values generated by applications using Paramiko for encryption purposes, potentially gaining access to sensitive information.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Paramiko users should upgrade to the latest version:
